body: @Hironsan @icoxfog417 @Loner233 : I am unable to replicate this bug. Can you please verify if this still exists?

@tusharmakkar08 Yes, It still exists.

Like this, I have the only one data in the last page.
![2020-04-08 17-00-20屏幕截图](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16119486/78765378-7f9b8d00-79ba-11ea-8628-5bba16627a17.png)

When I delete the data, It leads me to the 404 page if the debug == True.
![2020-04-08 17-00-35屏幕截图](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16119486/78765500-ac4fa480-79ba-11ea-911a-5c05805f97d6.png)
Hey @Loner233 Are you on the latest version of doccano? For me the link which is in your screenshot doesn't exist and interface also looks a lot different.
@tusharmakkar08 I pull from docker repository directly by `docker pull doccano/doccano`, not sure whether it is the latest verison doccano, but it should be the latest one in docker repository.
@icoxfog417 @Hironsan Is the version present in dockerhub the latest one? I doubt so because the issue isn't coming in the latest master build.

issue.title: Known issue about Page Access

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
**Please read this issue when you can't reach the page or faced strange navigation**  
**If you faced the following issue, please upvote 👍 related issue that let us judge priority .**

- [x] Can' access the page
  - [x] [Bug report] Annotator doesn't see the project #822
  - [x]  Deployment to cloud platform (Azure WebApp / Google Cloud Run/ Heroku) causes Request failed with status code 403 #1098


### Our correspondence

1. Make clear access control by role.
2. Make a clear concept of 404/403 navigation.
3. Make a clear recovery path from 404/403 page.
